dialogue: As large as life. For the moment he is inert. but he might run amuck any minute.
norm.dialogue: as large as life for the moment he is inert but he might run amuck any minute

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: You mean if we fell on him in his sleep?
norm.dialogue: you mean if we fell on him in his sleep

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: That seems a good idea all right. but could we do it? Is he really asleep? No, the best would be to take advantage of Pozzo's calling for help
norm.dialogue: that seems a good idea all right but could we do it is he really asleep no the best would be to take advantage of pozzos calling for help

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: In anticipation of some tangible return.
norm.dialogue: in anticipation of some tangible return

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Let us not waste our time in idle discourse! Let us do something, while we have the chance! It is not every day that we are needed. Not indeed that we personally are needed. Others would meet the case equally well, if not better. To all mankind they were addressed, those cries for help still ringing in our ears! but at this place, at this moment of time, all mankind is us, whether we like it or not. Let us make the most of it, before it is too late! Let us represent worthily for once the foul brood to which a cruel fate consigned us! What do you say? It is true that when with folded arms we weigh the pros and cons we are no less a credit to our species. The tiger bounds to the help of his congeners without the least reflection, or else he slinks away into the depths of the thickets. But that is not the question. What are we doing here, is the question. And we are blessed in this, that we happen to know the answer. Yes, in this immense confusion one thing alone is clear. We are waiting for Godot to come
norm.dialogue: let us not waste our time in idle discourse let us do something while we have the chance it is not every day that we are needed not indeed that we personally are needed others would meet the case equally well if not better to all mankind they were addressed those cries for help still ringing in our ears but at this place at this moment of time all mankind is us whether we like it or not let us make the most of it before it is too late let us represent worthily for once the foul brood to which a cruel fate consigned us what do you say it is true that when with folded arms we weigh the pros and cons we are no less a credit to our species the tiger bounds to the help of his congeners without the least reflection or else he slinks away into the depths of the thickets but that is not the question what are we doing here is the question and we are blessed in this that we happen to know the answer yes in this immense confusion one thing alone is clear we are waiting for godot to come

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
norm.dialogue: we are all born mad some remain so

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: I wouldn't go so far as that.
norm.dialogue: i wouldnt go so far as that

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: No, I mean so far as to assert that I was weak in the head when I came into the world. but that is not the question.
norm.dialogue: no i mean so far as to assert that i was weak in the head when i came into the world but that is not the question

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: What's the matter with you all?
norm.dialogue: whats the matter with you all

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Don't leave me! They'll kill me!
norm.dialogue: dont leave me theyll kill me

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Help me up first, then we'll go together.
norm.dialogue: help me up first then well go together

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: I've always wanted to wander in the Pyrenees.
norm.dialogue: ive always wanted to wander in the pyrenees

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Well I suppose in the end I'll get up by myself. In the fullness of time.
norm.dialogue: well i suppose in the end ill get up by myself in the fullness of time

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Come on, get up, you'll catch a chill.
norm.dialogue: come on get up youll catch a chill

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Come on, Didi, don't be pigheaded!
norm.dialogue: come on didi dont be pigheaded

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Did you hear him? He wants to know what happened!
norm.dialogue: did you hear him he wants to know what happened

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: It's this bastard Pozzo at it again.
norm.dialogue: its this bastard pozzo at it again

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Make him stop it. Kick him in the crotch.
norm.dialogue: make him stop it kick him in the crotch

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Will you stop it! Crablouse! He's off! He's down!
norm.dialogue: will you stop it crablouse hes off hes down

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Perhaps I could crawl to him.
norm.dialogue: perhaps i could crawl to him

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Or I could call to him.
norm.dialogue: or i could call to him

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Are you sure his name is Pozzo?
norm.dialogue: are you sure his name is pozzo

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Mr. Pozzo! Come back! We won't hurt you!
norm.dialogue: mr pozzo come back we wont hurt you

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: We might try him with other names.
norm.dialogue: we might try him with other names

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: To try him with other names, one after the other. It'd pass the time. And we'd be bound to hit on the right one sooner or later.
norm.dialogue: to try him with other names one after the other itd pass the time and wed be bound to hit on the right one sooner or later

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: I tell you his name is Pozzo.
norm.dialogue: i tell you his name is pozzo

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: I begin to weary of this motif.
norm.dialogue: i begin to weary of this motif

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Perhaps the other is called Cain. Cain! Cain!
norm.dialogue: perhaps the other is called cain cain cain

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Well? What is there so wonderful about it?
norm.dialogue: well what is there so wonderful about it

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Let's pass on now to something else, do you mind?
norm.dialogue: lets pass on now to something else do you mind

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: I was just going to suggest it.
norm.dialogue: i was just going to suggest it

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Suppose we got up to begin with?
norm.dialogue: suppose we got up to begin with

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Ah! What'll we do, what'll we do!
norm.dialogue: ah whatll we do whatll we do

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: He wants us to help him get up.
norm.dialogue: he wants us to help him get up

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Then why don't we? What are we waiting for?
norm.dialogue: then why dont we what are we waiting for

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: We must hold him. Feeling better?
norm.dialogue: we must hold him feeling better

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: No, he means friends of his.
norm.dialogue: no he means friends of his

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: We've proved we are, by helping him.
norm.dialogue: weve proved we are by helping him

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Exactly. Would we have helped him if we weren't his friends?
norm.dialogue: exactly would we have helped him if we werent his friends

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Don't let's quibble about that now.
norm.dialogue: dont lets quibble about that now

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Damn it, can't you see the man is blind!
norm.dialogue: damn it cant you see the man is blind

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Damn it, so he is. So he says.
norm.dialogue: damn it so he is so he says

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: That depends what time of year it is.
norm.dialogue: that depends what time of year it is

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Don't be a fool. It's the west over there.
norm.dialogue: dont be a fool its the west over there

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: It's evening, Sir, it's evening, night is drawing nigh. My friend here would have me doubt it and I must confess he shook me for a moment. but it is not for nothing I have lived through this long day and I can assure you it is very near the end of its repertory. How do you feel now?
norm.dialogue: its evening sir its evening night is drawing nigh my friend here would have me doubt it and i must confess he shook me for a moment but it is not for nothing i have lived through this long day and i can assure you it is very near the end of its repertory how do you feel now

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: How much longer are we to cart him around? We are not caryatids!
norm.dialogue: how much longer are we to cart him around we are not caryatids

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: You were saying your sight used to be good, if I heard you right.
norm.dialogue: you were saying your sight used to be good if i heard you right

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Let him alone. Can't you see he's thinking of the days when he was happy. that must be unpleasant.
norm.dialogue: let him alone cant you see hes thinking of the days when he was happy that must be unpleasant

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: And it came on you all of a sudden?
norm.dialogue: and it came on you all of a sudden

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: The two of you slipped. And fell.
norm.dialogue: the two of you slipped and fell

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: After what he did to me? Never!
norm.dialogue: after what he did to me never

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Don't take your eyes off me.
norm.dialogue: dont take your eyes off me

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Make sure he's alive before you start. No point in exerting yourself if he's dead.
norm.dialogue: make sure hes alive before you start no point in exerting yourself if hes dead

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: I was dreaming I was happy.
norm.dialogue: i was dreaming i was happy

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Don't tell me! I wonder is he really blind.
norm.dialogue: dont tell me i wonder is he really blind

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: He told us he was blind.
norm.dialogue: he told us he was blind

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: It seemed to me he saw us.
norm.dialogue: it seemed to me he saw us

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: You dreamt it. Let's go. We can't. Ah! Are you sure it wasn't him?
norm.dialogue: you dreamt it lets go we cant ah are you sure it wasnt him

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Not at all! Not at all! Not at all!
norm.dialogue: not at all not at all not at all

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: I suppose I might as well get up. Ow! Didi!
norm.dialogue: i suppose i might as well get up ow didi

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: I don't know what to think any more.
norm.dialogue: i dont know what to think any more

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Was I sleeping, while the others suffered? Am I sleeping now? Tomorrow, when I wake, or think I do, what shall I say of today? That with Estragon my friend, at this place, until the fall of night, I waited for Godot? That Pozzo passed, with his carrier, and that he spoke to us? Probably. but in all that what truth will there be? He'll know nothing. He'll tell me about the blows he received and I'll give him a carrot. Astride of a grave and a difficult birth. Down in the hole, lingeringly, the grave digger puts on the forceps. We have time to grow old. The air is full of our cries. But habit is a great deadener. At me too someone is looking, of me too someone is saying, He is sleeping, he knows nothing, let him sleep on. I can't go on! What have I said?
norm.dialogue: was i sleeping while the others suffered am i sleeping now tomorrow when i wake or think i do what shall i say of today that with estragon my friend at this place until the fall of night i waited for godot that pozzo passed with his carrier and that he spoke to us probably but in all that what truth will there be hell know nothing hell tell me about the blows he received and ill give him a carrot astride of a grave and a difficult birth down in the hole lingeringly the grave digger puts on the forceps we have time to grow old the air is full of our cries but habit is a great deadener at me too someone is looking of me too someone is saying he is sleeping he knows nothing let him sleep on i cant go on what have i said

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: Oh yes, let's go far away from here.
norm.dialogue: oh yes lets go far away from here

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: We have to come back tomorrow.
norm.dialogue: we have to come back tomorrow

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: And if we dropped him? If we dropped him?
norm.dialogue: and if we dropped him if we dropped him

dialogue: He'd punish us. Everything's dead but the tree.

dialogue: You haven't got a bit of rope?
norm.dialogue: you havent got a bit of rope

dialogue: You could hang onto my legs.
norm.dialogue: you could hang onto my legs

speaker: VLADIMIR
dialogue: Show me all the same. It might do in a pinch. but is it strong enough?
norm.dialogue: show me all the same it might do in a pinch but is it strong enough

dialogue: You say we have to come back tomorrow?
norm.dialogue: you say we have to come back tomorrow

dialogue: Then we can bring a good bit of rope.
norm.dialogue: then we can bring a good bit of rope

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: I can't go on like this.
norm.dialogue: i cant go on like this

speaker: ESTRAGON
dialogue: If we parted? That might be better for us.
